• Good knowledge of NYC regulatory municipalities
• Join design team in the presentation of design to clients
Please send us your resume and portfolio via email. Thank you!

text: Facade / Building Envelope Architects and Engineers
address: , New York City's leading professional firm dedicated to the preservation of buildings and infrastructure, is seeking resourceful architects and engineers with building envelope restoration experience to join us in executing a growing slate of challenging projects.  Openings are available for qualified individuals with from entry level to 10 years' professional experience.

We work on an array of building types, including courthouses, schools, universities, churches, and hospitals, and many of New York's most storied landmarks, from Trinity Church to Grand Central Terminal. Our work embraces all components of the building envelope and underlying structure—facades, roofs, windows, and plazas—and the full complement of materials, from historic terra-cotta to high-performance curtain walls. We’re proud to be an industry leader in crucial practice areas like Local Law 11 inspections and repairs. We've won numerous awards, as well as the loyalty of many of the premier public, corporate, and residential clients in the region.

You’ll work as part of a small team assigned to projects based on synergies between project requirements and the capabilities of each team member. This arrangement offers employees the dual advantages of a small office experience coupled with access to the centralized resources of a larger firm. You'll be supported by some of the most sophisticated technology in the profession, including proprietary computer systems and applications, advanced photography and image processing, and state-of-the-art, non-destructive diagnostic equipment and techniques.

Typically, you’ll participate in all phases of a project from inception through completion: proposal, investigation, construction documents, bid negotiation, and construction administration. You'll have the opportunity to see your designs executed in the field and you'll take on greater responsibility and client management as soon as you are ready.
We offer an array of benefits and growth opportunities:

Our new Wall Street office is in the landmarked former Bankers Trust Company Building (Trowbridge & Livingston, 1912). The bright, spacious office on the 25th floor has high ceilings and views of lower Manhattan in four directions. Just steps from Federal Hall and Trinity Church, we’re easily accessible via public transportation: the 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, R, W, J, Z, and A/C lines all stop within a few blocks of our building. NYC Ferry access at Pier 11 is at the foot of Wall Street and the PATH World Trade Center station is nearby.

If you’re excited about this opportunity, please send us your resume, a cover letter with salary requirements, and a few pages of attachments (maximum of 10MB, please) or link to your portfolio that demonstrates your experience and capabilities.
With thanks for your interest, please note that only those candidates under consideration will be contacted.
For additional information on our firm’s services, approach, and projects, visit
16 West 56th Street New York   NY  10019   Tel 212.243.2933   Fax 212.243.2868

address: As a small, reputable midtown Manhattan-based residential interior remodeling firm, we make it easier for homeowners to have renovations done because we handle everything from design and product selection assistance to orders, deliveries, permits and installations. We back it up with an on-time guarantee and 7 year labor and products warranty.
Our projects range from full apartment and house interior renovations to combining apartments, kitchens, basements, bathrooms. Prices range from 40k to 800k+.

This role requires proficiency in both residential interior design (min 10 yrs) and project management (min 5 yrs) of Co-op apartment and house interior renovations in New York City. You'll be serving both roles and taking projects from start to finish. Experience should include at least 10 projects in Manhattan or other major city and experience supervising trades in the field.
Prefer NYC resident or within 45 minutes commute.
Design competence in either SketchUp, AutoCAD, 20/20 or other design software.

An essential component of the job will be excellent and frequent communication with the client, The ideal candidate will know how to maintain good rapport with clients and be experienced enough to run projects, trouble-shoot and resolve problems quickly.

Design sales work will include meeting our client at their home/apartment and subsequently, designing, writing work scopes, meeting and guiding clients through product selections at our and other product showrooms. Creating products lists. Trades walkthroughs. Ongoing support. After that, project management work will include scheduling, site visits twice a week or more, coordinating and supervising trades and product deliveries, client interactions, timely completions. As the head of the team, you'll be running the project.
Hours may include some evening and weekend appointments based on client needs.
Real opportunities for advancement as we are growing fast (particularly in the last 3 years) and have a great location.

We work on an array of building types, including courthouses, schools, universities, churches, and hospitals, and many of New York's most storied landmarks, from Trinity Church to Grand Central Terminal. Our work embraces all components of the building envelope and underlying structure—facades, roofs, windows, and plazas—and the full complement of materials, from historic terra-cotta to high-performance curtain walls. We offer an array of benefits and growth opportunities:

Our new Wall Street office is in the landmarked former Bankers Trust Company Building (Trowbridge & Livingston, 1912). The bright, spacious office on the 25th floor has high ceilings and views of lower Manhattan in four directions. Just steps from Federal Hall and Trinity Church, we’re easily accessible via public transportation: the 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, R, W, J, Z, and A/C lines all stop within a few blocks of our building. NYC Ferry access at Pier 11 is at the foot of Wall Street and the PATH World Trade Center station is nearby.

Building Information Modeling (BIM) Coordinator involves firstly coordinating with the in-house estimating team to advise on what should be allowed for BIM coordination tasks for a particular project when bidding for projects. When Company is awarded projects, BIM Coordinator would attend meetings with general contractors and their respective subcontractors to discuss BIM requirements for the project and agree on expectations. Following this BIM Coordinator will take the base drawings (blueprints) which have been designed by the architects and use them to create a BIM model. The components of this model will be related to the drywall and/or ceiling work performed by the Company. e.g. Stud walls, acoustical ceilings & ceiling components, hanging details etc.

Weekly BIM coordination meetings are generally held at the jobsite as the virtual model is being created to coordinate with other trades on the job and solve any problems that arise. The software that is typically used is from Autodesk & normally includes BIM 360, BIM Glue, Navisworks, Revit & AutoCAD. At these meetings, the models which the other respective trades (plumbing, sprinkler, HVAC etc.) have created alongside the BIM Coordinator’s models, are combined into one to reflect the physical job buildout. Clash detection tests are run to determine potential points of conflict between, for example, critical members of walls & sprinkler pipes.

Following these meetings, BIM Coordinator will typically need to update models to reflect solutions developed to avoid clashes with other trades equipment & material. This process is an iterative one & normally lasts several months to fine tune the model before construction on site can commence. The main purpose of this entire process is to ensure smooth & efficient running of the actual project buildout once it has commenced, minimizing any delays & problems, thus saving both time and money for clients.

Once the project has commenced, BIM Coordinator will meet with the Company Foreman & Project Manager at the job site to discuss the plan that has been agreed to build out the job. Examples of this might include explaining & showing drawings of some ceiling framing alterations Company must make at a particular location to avoid a clash with ductwork running overhead. Another example could be moving the adjusting the stud spacing for a section of wall to accommodate a sprinkler main. As the job progresses, BIM Coordinator remains available to the foreman for any questions they may have throughout the project lifecycle to ensure it runs smoothly as far as BIM Coordinator’s scope of work is concerned.

BIM Coordinator must design & draw up various details of components the Company would then physically construct at projects. Software used here would include AutoCAD & Revit to design and represent the details. Examples include knife edges/light coves, specialty ceiling designs & framing details, ramps, platforms, hanging/mounting details for fabric panels etc. The details required vary often by project. These designs then must be submitted to the architect who designed the project and approved by them which allows the Company to then physically construct per the approved detail BIM Coordinator has created.
Depending on the complexity of the detail, BIM Coordinator will sometimes need to visit the foreman on site to explain the detail the design intention including how it was created by BIM Coordinator.

Coupled with the duties above, the Company has weekly meetings to discuss project progress which BIM Coordinator typically takes part in. Involvement in these meetings normally includes providing approximate milestone dates such when BIM Coordinators thinks a project buildout will begin (so foremen and workers can be scheduled ahead of time), updating the accounting department on the percentage of work complete to date and discussing general company goals.
Daily supervision of one (1) CAD Technician.

text: Facade / Building Envelope Architects and Engineers
address: , New York City's leading professional firm dedicated to the preservation of buildings and infrastructure, is seeking resourceful architects and engineers with building envelope restoration experience to join us in executing a growing slate of challenging projects.  Openings are available for qualified individuals with from 2 to 10 years' professional experience.

We work on an array of building types, including courthouses, schools, universities, churches, and hospitals, and many of New York's most storied landmarks, from Trinity Church to Grand Central Terminal. Our work embraces all components of the building envelope and underlying structure—facades, roofs, windows, and plazas—and the full complement of materials, from historic terra-cotta to high-performance curtain walls. We’re proud to be an industry leader in crucial practice areas like Local Law 11 inspections and repairs. We've won numerous awards, as well as the loyalty of many of the premier public, corporate, and residential clients in the region.

You’ll work as part of a small team assigned to projects based on synergies between project requirements and the capabilities of each team member. This arrangement offers employees the dual advantages of a small office experience coupled with access to the centralized resources of a larger firm. You'll be supported by some of the most sophisticated technology in the profession, including proprietary computer systems and applications, advanced photography and image processing, and state-of-the-art, non-destructive diagnostic equipment and techniques.

Typically, you’ll participate in all phases of a project from inception through completion: proposal, investigation, construction documents, bid negotiation, and construction administration. You'll have the opportunity to see your designs executed in the field and you'll take on greater responsibility and client management as soon as you are ready.
We offer an array of benefits and growth opportunities:

Our new Wall Street office is in the landmarked former Bankers Trust Company Building (Trowbridge & Livingston, 1912). The bright, spacious office on the 25th floor has high ceilings and views of lower Manhattan in four directions. Just steps from Federal Hall and Trinity Church, we’re easily accessible via public transportation: the 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, R, W, J, Z, and A/C lines all stop within a few blocks of our building. NYC Ferry access at Pier 11 is at the foot of Wall Street and the PATH World Trade Center station is nearby.

If you’re excited about this opportunity, please send us your resume, a cover letter with salary requirements, and a few pages of attachments (maximum of 10MB, please) or link to your portfolio that demonstrates your experience and capabilities.
With thanks for your interest, please note that only those candidates under consideration will be contacted.
